response.answer_text: y=a+b-c PREMISES y=a+(b-c) CALCULATIONS y=a+(b-c) (Remove the superfluous parentheses since addition and subtraction are binary operations and the “order of operations” is insignificant to the result) Hence, y= a+b-c C.H.
Well, a+(b−c)=a+b−c=a−c+ba+(b−c)=a+b−c=a−c+b On the other hand, ….a−(b−c)=a−b+ca−(b−c)=a−b+c
